sen.j: 日本の交通（にほんのこうつう）では、日本の交通の歴史や状況などを述べる。
sen.e: This section, "Transportation in Japan," describes the history and conditions of transportation in Japan.
This section, "Transportation in Japan," describes the history and conditions of transportation in Japan.
This section, "Transportation in Japan," describes the history and conditions of transportation in Japan.

sen.j: 概説
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 蒸気機関や内燃機関が導入される以前において、日本の支配層は交通を活発にすることにあまり好意的ではなかった。
sen.e: Before the steam engine and the internal-combustion engine were introduced, members of the ruling class in Japan had not been very active in enhancing the transportation.
Before the steam engine and the internal-combustion engine were introduced, members of the ruling class in Japan had not been very active in enhancing transportation.
Before the steam engine and the internal-combustion engine were introduced, members of the ruling class in Japan had not been very active in enhancing transportation.

sen.j: その理由としては物や人の出入りが盛んになることによって、伝統・秩序の保持や、軍事的な理由などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Some of the reasons for that include concerns about maintenance of the traditions and social order due to active turnover of people or objects, and military reasons.
Some of the reasons including concerns about maintaining traditions and social order due to the active turnover of people or property, and for military reasons.
Some of the reasons include concerns about maintaining traditions and social order due to the active turnover of people or property, and for military reasons.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』においても、人々の往来を妨害する神（「荒神」）や地元の人々の存在が多数登場しており、大化の改新直後においても旅人がその地域の慣習を知らずに禁忌を犯したためにその地域の人々に処罰されていることが問題視されているなどの記載がある。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Kojin, a god who makes a traffic of people stop, and other local people are introduced, and descriptions about immediately after the Taika Reforms include that some travelers were punished by the local people because they violated a taboo without knowing the custom in the area.

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Kojin, a god who makes human traffic stop, and other local people are introduced, and descriptions about immediately after the Taika Reforms include that some travelers were punished by local people because they violated a taboo not knowing the customs in the area.

In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Kojin (a god) and other local people who make human traffic stop are introduced, and descriptions include that, immediately after the Taika Reforms, some travelers were punished by local people because they violated a taboo not knowing the customs in the area.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 国家としての形態を成すために、日本においても日本の首都と令制国の国府を結ぶ主要道路は整備された。
sen.e: To form a shape as a nation, in Japan too, major roads, which connect the capital of Japan and the kokufu (provincial office) of each ryoseikoku (province), were improved.
To form a shape as a nation, in Japan too, major roads, which connect the capital of Japan and the kokufu (provincial office) of each ryoseikoku (province), were improved.
To form a shape as a nation, in Japan too, major roads, which connect the capital of Japan and the kokufu (provincial office) of each ryoseikoku (province), were improved.

sen.j: しかし、地方間同士の交通は農民の逃亡を助けることになるとして主要官道を除いてはほとんど整備されず、地方の川には年貢を都へ運ぶ時だけ舟橋をかければ良いと考えられていた（『日本紀略』の延暦20年5月甲戌条）。
sen.e: However, most roads except major Kando (roads that were improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) were not improved because the government was afraid that improving the traffic connecting among local regions might help farmers flee from the region, and thus the government believed that it should be enough to prepare a bridge of boats on rivers in the local regions only when nengu (land tax) needed to be transported to the capital (Kinoeinu-jo in May 801 of "Nihongi Ryaku" (Summary of Japanese Chronologies)).

However, most roads except major Kando (roads that were improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) were not improved because the government was afraid that improving the traffic connecting among local regions might help farmers flee from the region, and thus the government believed that it should be enough to prepare a bridge of boats on rivers in the local regions only when nengu (land tax) needed to be transported to the capital (Kinoeinu-jo in May 801 of "Nihongi Ryaku" (Summary of Japanese Chronologies)).

However, most roads except major Kando (roads that were improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) were not improved because the government was afraid that improving the traffic connecting among local regions might help farmers flee from the region, and thus the government believed that it should be enough to prepare a bridge of boats on rivers in the local regions only when nengu (land tax) needed to be transported to the capital (Kinoeinu-jo in May 801 of "Nihongi Ryaku" (Summary of Japanese Chronologies)).

sen.j: 江戸時代においても軍事的・政治的理由として大きな河川には橋はかけられず、鎖国（海禁政策）や大船建造の禁（武家諸法度の一部）が出された他、江戸防衛を理由に街道筋の牛馬車など車両使用した物流を禁じる方針を採った。
sen.e: In Edo period too, bridges were not built across the major rivers for military and political reasons, and the government not only issued the national isolation policy (Kaikin Policy (the policy to forbid private people to trade with foreign countries)) and the ban on production of large ships (a part of Buke shohatto (Laws for the Military Houses)) but also prohibited distribution using vehicles such as horse- or cow-drawn buggies on Kaido to protect Edo.

During the Edo period too, bridges were not built across major rivers for military and political reasons, and the government not only issued the national isolation policy (Kaikin Policy - the policy to forbid private people to trade with foreign countries) and the ban on production of large ships (a part of Buke shohatto - Laws for the Military Houses), but also prohibited distribution using vehicles such as horse- or cow-drawn buggies on Kaido to protect Edo.

During the Edo period too, bridges were not built across major rivers for military and political reasons, and the government not only issued the national isolation policy (Kaikin Policy - the policy to forbid private people to trade with foreign countries) and the ban on production of large ships (a part of Buke shohatto - Laws for the Military Houses), but also prohibited distribution using vehicles such as horse- or cow-drawn buggies on Kaido (road) to protect Edo.
sen.cmt: 街道 に (road)と補足しました。

sen.j: このため、日本の道路は鋪装されることがほとんどなく、車輪を用いた車は大八車といった荷物運搬用以外に用いられることは、牛車などしかなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, roads in Japan were hardly ever surfaced, and vehicles with wheels used on the roads in Japan were only load-carrying vehicles, such as large carts, and some cow-drawn buggies.
Therefore, roads in Japan were hardly ever surfaced, and vehicles with wheels used on the roads in Japan were only load-carrying vehicles, such as large carts, and some cow-drawn buggies.
Therefore, roads in Japan were hardly ever surfaced, and vehicles with wheels used on the roads in Japan were only load-carrying vehicles, such as large carts, and some cow-drawn buggies.

sen.j: また、ウマの使用についても制限が加えられていた。
sen.e: Moreover, use of horses was also limited.
Moreover, use of horses was also limited.
Moreover, use of horses was also limited.

sen.j: 物資の輸送には川舟や小型の商船が用いられており、大都市では水路が発達していた。
sen.e: For transportation of goods, river boats or small merchant ships were used, and thus water routes were well-developed.
For the transport of goods, river boats or small merchant ships were used, and thus water routes were well-developed.
For the transport of goods, river boats or small merchant ships were used, and thus water routes were well-developed.

sen.j: 明治維新を経て、日本は近代国家へと成長をしていく。
sen.e: After the Meiji restoration, Japan began developing into a modern state.
After the Meiji restoration, Japan began developing into a modern state.
After the Meiji Restoration, Japan began developing into a modern state.

sen.j: 早急に整備を進めるために主に鉄道網を構築することが優先されたため、道路についてはあまり整備されなかった。
sen.e: To promptly improve the transportation systems in Japan, the government gave priority mainly to the improvement of the railway network and thus did not focus on the road maintenance and construction so much.

To promptly improve the transportation systems in Japan, the government placed priority mainly on the improvement of the railway network and thus did not focus on road maintenance and construction so much.

To promptly improve the transportation systems in Japan, the government placed priority mainly on the improvement of the railway network and thus did not focus on road maintenance and construction so much.

sen.j: 道路については戦後に本格的な整備が始まった。
sen.e: The road maintenance and construction were seriously started after the war.
The road maintenance and construction were seriously started after the war.
The road maintenance and construction were seriously started after the war.

sen.j: 高度経済成長期には本格的な自動車専用道路である高速道路が、日本で初めて登場した（名神高速道路）。
sen.e: In the high economic growth period, an expressway (Meishin Expressway) was constructed for the first time in Japan.
sen.cmt: 日本語と違って、英語では「自動車専用道路」も「高速道路」も「expressway」または「freeway」などと訳すことになるため、「自動車専用道路」を「高速道路」の説明的な名詞として使用する事が、英語では出来ないと考え、単に左記のように致しました。
sen.e: In the high economic growth period, the expressway (Meishin Expressway) was constructed for the first time in Japan.
In the high economic growth period, the expressway (Meishin Expressway) was constructed for the first time in Japan.

sen.j: その後は東京オリンピックや大阪万博などを契機に新幹線や都市高速道路の整備がはじまり、現在では総延長14000kmの高速道路網が整備されており、新幹線についても整備が進んだ。
sen.e: After that, with the Tokyo Olympic Games, the Osaka Expo, and other large events, improvement of Shinkansen lines and urban expressways began, resulting in today's 14000km-expressway network and advanced Shinkansen lines.

After that, with the Tokyo Olympic Games, the Osaka Expo, and other large events, improvement of Shinkansen lines and urban expressways began, resulting in today's 14000km-expressway network and advanced Shinkansen lines.

After that, with the Tokyo Olympic Games, the Osaka Expo, and other large events, improvement of Shinkansen (bullet trains) lines and urban expressways began, resulting in today's 14,000km-expressway network and advanced Shinkansen lines.
sen.cmt: 新幹線に bullet trains と補足しました。

sen.j: しかし、モータリゼーションの進展による中心市街地の衰退など様々な面でひずみを抱えている状況にある。
sen.e: However, the transportation in Japan has some problems in various aspects, for example, waning city center due to advance of the motorization.
However, transportation in Japan has some problems in various aspects, for example, waning city center due to advance of motorization.
However, transportation in Japan has some problems in various aspects, for example, waning city center due to advance of motorization.

sen.j: 交通の歴史
sen.e: History of the transportation
History of transportation
History of transportation

sen.j: 律令時代
sen.e: Ritsuryo era
Ritsuryo era
Ritsuryo era

sen.j: 古代は律令制の整備に伴い、駅制が敷かれて都（畿内）と地方の間に道路が整備され、駅家が置かれた。
sen.e: In ancient times, along with the development of Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), roads were developed between the capital (Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto)) in which the Eki transportation system was established and local regions, and Umaya (regular intervals stages) were set up on the ways.

In ancient times, along with the development of the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), roads were developed between the capital (Kinai region - the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) in which the Eki transportation system was established and local regions, and Umaya (regular intervals stages) were set up on the ways.

In ancient times, along with the development of the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), roads were developed based on the Eki transportation system between the capital (Kinai region - the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) and local regions, and Umaya (regular intervals stages) were set up on the ways.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。

sen.j: これを日本の古代道路というが、古代官道は地方広域区分である五畿七道に沿って整備された。
sen.e: These roads are called ancient roads, and ancient Kando (a kind of ancient roads) were developed along with Goki-Shichido (five provinces and seven circuits), which were local regional divisions.
These roads are called ancient roads, and ancient Kando (a kind of ancient roads) were developed along with Goki-Shichido (five provinces and seven circuits), which were local regional divisions.
These roads are called ancient roads, and ancient Kando were developed along with Goki-Shichido (five provinces and seven circuits), which were local regional divisions.
sen.cmt: 官道 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 五畿七道：畿内、西海道、南海道、山陽道、山陰道、東海道、東山道、北陸道
sen.e: Goki-Shichido: Kinai, Saikaido Road, Nankai-do Road, Sanyodo Road, Sanin-do Road, Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road, and Hokuriku-do Road.
Goki-Shichido: Kinai, Saikaido Road, Nankai-do Road, Sanyodo Road, Sanin-do Road, Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road, and Hokuriku-do Road.
Goki-Shichido: Kinai, Saikai-do Road, Nankai-do Road, Sanyo-do Road, Sanin-do Road, Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road, and Hokuriku-do Road.
sen.cmt: ハイフン+ do に統一しました。

sen.j: 戦国時代まで
sen.e: Up to the Sengoku period (period of warring states)
Up to the Sengoku period (period of warring states)
Up to the Sengoku period (period of warring states)

sen.j: 中世には都市の発達に伴い、年貢や物資の輸送の必要性から陸上交通が整備され、定期市なども開かれた。
sen.e: In the Medieval period, with the development of urban areas, land transport was improved because of the necessity for transporting nengu (land tax), and periodical markets and other events were also opened.

In the Medieval period, with the development of urban areas, land transport was improved because of the necessity for transporting nengu (land tax), and periodical markets and other events were also opened.
In the Medieval period, with the development of urban areas, land transport was improved because of the necessity for transporting nengu, and periodical markets and other events were also opened.
sen.cmt: 年貢 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: これに伴い、港や廻船も整備され、海上交通や海上輸送も行われるようになる。
sen.e: Along with this, ports and cargo-vessels were also improved, and maritime traffic and maritime transportation were also started accordingly.
Along with this, ports and cargo-vessels were also improved, and maritime traffic and maritime transportation were also started accordingly.
Along with this, ports and cargo-vessels were also improved, and maritime traffic and maritime transportation were also started accordingly.

sen.j: 交通の要所には、幕府や戦国大名や有力寺社などが関所を設置して、関銭が徴収された。
sen.e: The government, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, and major temples and shrines set up sekisho (checking stations) at check points of traffic to collect sekisen (toll).
The government, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, and major temples and shrines set up sekisho (checking stations) at check points of traffic to collect sekisen (toll).
The government, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, and major temples and shrines set up sekisho (checking stations) at check points of traffic to collect sekisen (toll).
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo period
Edo period
Edo period

sen.j: 街道
sen.e: Kaido
Kaido

sen.j: 宿場町の発展
sen.e: Development of post-station towns
Development of post-station towns
Development of post-station towns

sen.j: 五街道（始点：日本橋 (東京都中央区)）：東海道、中山道、甲州街道、奥州街道、日光街道
sen.e: Go-kaido Road (starting point: Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo)): Tokai-do Road, Nakasen-do Road, Koshu-kaido Road, Oshu-kaido Road, and Nikko-kaido Road
Go-kaido Road (starting point: Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo): Tokai-do Road, Nakasen-do Road, Koshu-kaido Road, Oshu-kaido Road, and Nikko-kaido Road

sen.j: 樽廻船、菱垣廻船
sen.e: Taru-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels), Higaki-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels)
Taru-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels), Higaki-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels)
Taru-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels), Higaki-kaisen (a kind of cargo vessels)

sen.j: 駕籠、馬（馬子）、北前船など。
sen.e: Palanquin, horse (Umako), Kitamae-bune (a cargo vessel), etc.
Palanquin, horse (Umako), Kitamae-bune (a cargo vessel), etc.
Palanquin, horse (Umako), Kitamae-bune (a cargo vessel), etc.

sen.j: 明治から第二次大戦まで
sen.e: From the Meiji period to the World War II
From the Meiji period to World War II
From the Meiji period to World War II

sen.j: 明治時代に入ると近代国家になるために交通網を整備する必要があった。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Japan had an increased need for traffic network to be a modern state.
During the Meiji period, Japan had an increased need for traffic network to become a modern state.
During the Meiji period, Japan had an increased need for traffic network to become a modern state.

sen.j: 整備を進めやすいために道路よりも鉄道を優先して建設された。
sen.e: To promote the traffic network, the construction of railways was given priority over that of roads.
To promote traffic network, the construction of railways was given priority over that of roads.
To promote traffic network, the construction of railways was given priority over that of roads.

sen.j: 鉄道の建設には多くの問題や妨碍が為されたが、品川・横浜間で仮営業が始められた後、新橋・横浜間の営業が始められた。
sen.e: Although there were many problems and obstacles in the way of railway construction, temporary operations began between Shinagawa and Yokohama, and then operations between Shinbashi and Yokohama started.

Although there were many problems and obstacles in the way of railway construction, temporary operations began between Shinagawa and Yokohama, and then operations between Shinbashi and Yokohama started.

Although there were many problems and obstacles in the way of railway construction, temporary operations began between Shinagawa and Yokohama, and then operations between Shinbashi and Yokohama started.

sen.j: これを契機として、官民両者による鉄道の建設が進められた。
sen.e: After this, railway construction was promoted by both the private and public sectors.
After this, railway construction was promoted by both the private and public sectors.
After this, railway construction was promoted by both the private and public sectors.

sen.j: また、都市内においては路面電車や地下鉄が整備され、馬車が走るためにガス灯や舗装が進められた。
sen.e: In addition, in large cities, streetcars and subways were constructed and improved, and gas lamps and pavement were also improved for horse-drawn buggies.
In addition, in large cities, streetcars and subways were constructed and improved, and gas lamps and pavement were also improved for horse-drawn buggies.
In addition, in large cities, streetcars and subways were constructed and improved, and gas lamps and pavement were also improved for horse-drawn buggies.

sen.j: 人力車、馬車鉄道、人車軌道など：明治初期
sen.e: Jinrikisha (a taxi-like vehicle pulled by a man), horse tramway, Jinsha-kido (a railway system in which men push a passage car or a freight car), etc.: early Meiji period
Jinrikisha (a taxi-like vehicle pulled by a man), horse tramway, Jinsha-kido (a railway system in which men push a passage car or a freight car), etc.: early Meiji period
Jinrikisha (a taxi-like vehicle pulled by a man), horse tramway, Jinsha-kido (a railway system in which men push a passage car or a freight car), etc.: early Meiji period

sen.j: 平地が少なく険しい山地が多い国土→トンネル
sen.e: National land with only a few flat lands and many steep mountains -> tunnels
National land with only a few flat lands and many steep mountains -> tunnels
National land with only a few flat lands and many steep mountains -> tunnels

sen.j: 第二次大戦後
sen.e: After World War II

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中まで国道にあっても舗装率は非常に低い状況など自動車用の道路の整備があまり進まなかった。
sen.e: In the World War II, the pavement ratio of even National Routes was very low, and the improvement of roads for automobiles was not promoted well.
During World War II, the pavement ratio of even National Routes was very low, and the improvement of roads for automobiles was not promoted well.
During World War II, the pavement ratio of even National Routes was very low, and the improvement of roads for automobiles was not promoted well.

sen.j: 経済復興のため、名古屋と神戸を結ぶ名古屋・神戸高速道路（現在の名神高速道路）が計画されたが、高速道路の計画をたてられる交通工学の技術者が日本にはいなかったために国際連合に要請して計画書の策定がされた。
sen.e: For economic reconstruction, a Nagoya-Kobe Expressway (current Meishin Expressway) that would connect Nagoya and Kobe was planned; however, because there were no traffic engineers who could make a plan of expressway in Japan then, the Japanese government asked the United Nations to formulate the plan.

For economic reconstruction, a Nagoya-Kobe Expressway (current Meishin Expressway) that would connect Nagoya and Kobe was planned; however, because there were no traffic engineers who could make a plan of expressway in Japan then, the Japanese government asked the United Nations to formulate the plan.

For economic reconstruction, a Nagoya-Kobe Expressway (current Meishin Expressway) that would connect Nagoya and Kobe was planned; however, because there were no traffic engineers who could make a plan of expressway in Japan then, the Japanese government asked the United Nations to formulate the plan.

sen.j: それが1956年にだされたワトキンス・レポートである。
sen.e: This is the Watkins Report issued in 1956.
This is the Watkins Report issued in 1956.
This is the Watkins Report issued in 1956.

sen.j: そのレポートの記述は以下の通りである。
sen.e: In this report, the comment says "The roads of Japan are incredibly bad. No other industrial nation has so completely neglected its highway system."
sen.cmt: コメント部分は、実際の英文から採用いたしました。
sen.e: In this report, the comment says; "The roads of Japan are incredibly bad. No other industrial nation has so completely neglected its highway system."
This report has the following comment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処原文（和文）を変更しましたので、英文もそれに合わせました。

sen.j: 「日本の道路は信じがたい程に悪い。工業国にして、これ程道路を無視してきた国は日本の他にない。」
sen.cmt: 上記の文章と一緒にして訳出いたしました。
sen.e: 'The roads of Japan are incredibly bad. No other industrial nation has so completely neglected its highway system.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処原文（和文）を変更しましたので、英文もそれに合わせました。

sen.j: この報告書も後押しとなり、日本の道路整備は飛躍的に進んでいくことになる。
sen.e: Inspired by this report, the road maintenance and improvement in Japan began making dramatic progress after this.
Inspired by this report, road maintenance and improvement in Japan began making dramatic progress.
Inspired by this report, road maintenance and improvement in Japan began making dramatic progress.

sen.j: 鉄道においては高速化のために蒸気機関車から気動車（ディーゼルカー）や鉄道の電化への転換が進められていった。
sen.e: In the railway construction, trains were shifted from steam locomotive to diesel trains or electric trains.
In railway construction, trains were shifted from steam locomotive to diesel trains or electric trains.
In railway construction, trains were shifted from steam locomotive to diesel trains (diesel car) or electric trains.
sen.cmt: (ディーゼルカー） を追加しました。

sen.j: 敗戦の影響で、航空機の開発を制限された日本では航空機製造の分野では振るわなかったが、戦前に活躍した技術者の多くが車産業へと鞍替えすることで日本の自動車産業の成長を支えることなった。
sen.e: In Japan, where the development of aircrafts was limited due to Japan's defeat in the war, many engineers, who did not do well in aircraft manufacturing but were active before the war, pushed back the boundaries of automobile industry and supported the growth of the Auto industry in Japan.

In Japan, where the development of aircraft was limited due to Japan's defeat in the war, many engineers, who did not do well in aircraft manufacturing, but were active before the war, pushed back the boundaries of the automobile industry and supported the growth of the Auto industry in Japan.

In Japan, where the development of aircraft was limited due to Japan's defeat in the war, many engineers, who did not do well in aircraft manufacturing, but were active before the war, pushed back the boundaries of the automobile industry and supported the growth of the auto industry in Japan.

sen.j: 1964年の東京オリンピックに合わせて、東名高速道路の建設や東海道新幹線の開通などが相次いだ。
sen.e: In time for the Tokyo Olympic Games held in 1964, the Tomei Expressway was constructed and the operation of Tokaido Shinkansen started.
In time for the Tokyo Olympic Games held in 1964, the Tomei Expressway was constructed and the operation of Tokaido Shinkansen started.
In time for the Tokyo Olympic Games held in 1964, the Tomei Expressway was constructed and the operation of Tokaido Shinkansen started.

sen.j: また、東京特別区の首都高速道路も1962年に一部開通し、これは日本初の都市高速道路でもあった。
sen.e: The Metropolitan Expressway, which is a Tokyo Special Ward and the first urban expressway in Japan, was also partially opened to traffic in 1962.
The Metropolitan Expressway, which is a Tokyo Special Ward and the first urban expressway in Japan, was also partially opened to traffic in 1962.
The Metropolitan Expressway, which was constructed in tje Tokyo Special Ward and the first urban expressway in Japan, was also partially opened to traffic in 1962.
sen.cmt: 「東京特別区に建設された首都高速」、という表現にしました。

sen.j: また、1960年代後半頃からマイカーの普及が本格化し、自動車の台数が大幅に増加した（モータリゼーション）。
sen.e: From the late 1960's, the growing popularity of privately-owned cars dramatically increased, and thus the number of cars accordingly increased substantially (motorization).
From the late 1960's, the growing popularity of privately-owned cars dramatically increased, and thus the number of cars accordingly increased substantially (motorization).
From the late 1960's, the growing popularity of privately-owned cars dramatically increased, and thus the number of cars accordingly increased substantially (motorization).

sen.j: その一方で、道路や自動車の利用環境の整備の遅れなどから交通事故も激増し、いわゆる交通戦争が起こった。
sen.e: On the other hand, traffic accidents also increased drastically because of a delay in improving roads and environments for the usage of cars, resulting in the so-called traffic war.
On the other hand, traffic accidents also increased drastically because of a delay in improving roads and environments for the usage of cars, resulting in the so-called traffic war.
On the other hand, traffic accidents also increased drastically because of a delay in improving roads and environments for the usage of cars, resulting in the so-called traffic war.

sen.j: また，暴走族の出現も問題となった。
sen.e: The emergence of motorcycle gangs also emerged as a social issue.
The emergence of motorcycle gangs also became a social issue.
The emergence of motorcycle gangs also became a social issue.

sen.j: 交通事故防止の対策として、横断歩道橋の設置による歩車分離を実施していった。
sen.e: For the prevention of traffic accidents, a system in which sidewalks and driveways were separated was promoted by introducing pedestrian bridges.
For the prevention of traffic accidents, a system in which sidewalks and driveways were separated was promoted by introducing pedestrian bridges.
For the prevention of traffic accidents, a system in which sidewalks and driveways were separated was promoted by introducing pedestrian bridges.

sen.j: 乗用車の保有台数は1971年（昭和46年）には1000万台に達した。
sen.e: The number of automobiles owned in Japan reached 10 million by 1971.
The number of automobiles owned in Japan reached 10 million by 1971.
The number of automobiles owned in Japan reached 10 million by 1971.

sen.j: 在来鉄道がモータリゼーション進展の波に押されて停滞する一方で、高速旅客鉄道である新幹線は日本の大動脈へと成長していく。
sen.e: While the development of conventional railway was overwhelmed by the wave of motorization and thus slowing down, Shinkansen lines, the high speed passenger railway, started growing as a main artery of Japan.

While the development of th econventional railway was overwhelmed by the wave of motorization and thus slowing down, Shinkansen lines, the high speed passenger railway, started growing as a main artery of Japan.

While the development of the conventional railway was overwhelmed by the wave of motorization and thus slowing down, Shinkansen lines, the high speed passenger railway, started growing as a main artery of Japan.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、自動車と航空旅客輸送の間を埋める日本の新幹線の成功は、停滞傾向にあった鉄道の見直し機運を与え、ヨーロッパやアジアの国々にも高速旅客鉄道を登場させる動機となった。
sen.e: In addition, the success of Shinkansen, which bridged a gap between automobiles and passenger transportation by airplane, triggered a review of the improvement of railways, which was slowing down in Japan then, and motivated European and Asian nations to build a high speed passenger railway.

In addition, the success of the Shinkansen, which bridged a gap between automobiles and passenger transportation by airplane, triggered a review of the improvement of railways, which was slowing down in Japan then, and motivated European and Asian nations to build a high speed passenger railway.

In addition, the success of the Shinkansen, which bridged a gap between automobiles and passenger transportation by airplane, triggered a review of the improvement of railways, which was slowing down in Japan then, and also motivated European and Asian nations to build a high speed passenger railway.

sen.j: 資源の多くを海外に頼る日本では、戦前から造船技術が発達し、戦後も大型タンカーなどの建造が活発に行われ、鉄鋼業とともに日本の経済と物流の一翼を担った。
sen.e: In Japan, where many resources are sent form foreign countries, the shipbuilding technology had been well improved since preWar periods, and even after the war, shipbuilding including large tankers was actively carried out, which played a role, with the steel industry, in economics and distribution in Japan.

In Japan, where many resources are sent form foreign countries, shipbuilding technology had been well improved since preWar periods, and even after the war, shipbuilding including large tankers was actively carried out, which played a role, with the steel industry, in economics and distribution in Japan.

In Japan, where many resources are sent form foreign countries, shipbuilding technology had been well improved since pre-war periods, and even after the war, shipbuilding including large tankers was actively carried out, which played a role, with the steel industry, in economics and distribution in Japan.

sen.j: また、空港の整備が進められ、航空輸送が徐々に拡大した。
sen.e: At the same time, the improvement of airports was promoted as well, and thus the size of air transportation gradually expanded.
At the same time, the improvement of airports was promoted as well, and thus the size of air transportation gradually increased.
At the same time, the improvement of airports was promoted as well, and thus the size of air transportation gradually increased.

sen.j: 円 (通貨)の価値が一段と上昇した1980年代以降は、海外へのビジネスや旅行の渡航も活発になった。
sen.e: After the late 1980's, when the yen became stronger, both business and private travelling overseas became popular.
After the late 1980's, when the yen became stronger, both business and private travelling overseas became popular.
After the late 1980's, when the yen (currency) became stronger, both business and private traveling overseas became popular.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 現在の日本の交通
sen.e: Current transportation in Japan
Current transportation in Japan
Current transportation in Japan

sen.j: 道路
sen.e: Roads
Roads
Roads

sen.j: 高度成長期までは日本の道路は劣悪であったが、1960年代以降盛んに道路建設が行われ、全国に高水準の道路整備が行き渡っている。
sen.e: Before the high-growth period, roads in Japan were bad, but the improvement and construction of roads have been actively implemented since 1960's, achieving provision of highly maintained roads throughout Japan.
Before the high-growth period, roads in Japan were bad, but the improvement and construction of roads have been actively implemented since 1960's, achieving highly maintained roads throughout Japan.
Before the high-growth period, roads in Japan were bad, but the improvement and construction of roads have been actively implemented since 1960's, achieving highly maintained roads throughout Japan.

sen.j: 高速道路の建設も進み、ほぼ全国に高速道路網が整備されている。
sen.e: Today, more and more expressways have been constructed and the expressway network has been spreading nearly over Japan.
Today, more and more expressways have been constructed and the expressway network has been spreading nearly all over Japan.
Today, more and more expressways have been constructed and the expressway network has been spreading nearly all over Japan.

sen.j: 安全対策の進展により交通事故による死者数は減少しているが、交通量が増え高齢化も進んでいることから、交通事故数は増加しつづけている。
sen.e: Although the number of deaths from traffic accidents has been reducing as traffic safety measures have been advanced, the number of traffic accidents have been increasing along with the increase in traffic and the progress in aging.

Although the number of deaths from traffic accidents has been reduced as traffic safety measures have been advanced, the number of traffic accidents have been increasing along with the increase in traffic and the progress in aging.

Although the number of deaths from traffic accidents has been reduced as traffic safety measures have been advanced, the number of traffic accidents have been increasing along with the increase in traffic and the progress in aging.

sen.j: 現在の財政状況から道路整備予算は圧縮される傾向にあり、道路公団民営化や道路特定財源の一般財源化など制度面での変化が起こっている。
sen.e: Based on the current financial situations, the budget for road improvement tends to be reduced, and some changes in institutions, including privatization of Japan Highway Public Corporation and shifting the road-related tax revenue to the general revenue, are now occurring.

Based on the current financial situation, the budget for road improvement tends to be reduced, and some changes in institutions, including privatization of Japan Highway Public Corporation and shifting road-related tax revenue to general revenue, are now occurring.

Based on the current financial situation, the budget for road improvement tends to be reduced, and some changes in institutions, including privatization of Japan Highway Public Corporation and shifting road-related tax revenue to general revenue, are now occurring.

sen.j: 鉄道
sen.e: Railway
Railway
Railway

sen.j: 車の利用増加に伴って、日本の鉄道の利用割合は減少を続けている。
sen.e: Along with the increase in uses of automobiles, the ratio of people who use railway has been decreasing in Japan.
Along with the increase in uses of automobiles, the ratio of people who use railway has been decreasing in Japan.
Along with the increase in uses of automobiles, the ratio of people who use railway has been decreasing in Japan.

sen.j: そのため、特に地方においては廃止される路線もある。
sen.e: Therefore, there are some railways which are discontinued, especially in rural areas.
Therefore, there are some railways which have discontinued, especially in rural areas.
Therefore, there are some railways which have discontinued, especially in rural areas.

sen.j: 一方で、経済発展になるという理由で、新幹線が整備されていない地域では新幹線を求める声が依然として大きい。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is still considerable discussion about the need for Shinkansen in the regions with no Shinkannsen lines, because it will encourage economic development.
On the other hand, there is still considerable discussion about the need for Shinkansen in regions with no Shinkannsen lines, because it would encourage economic development.

sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、ヨーロッパで広まったLRTが導入された(富山ライトレール)り、パークライドのための駐車場の整備がされたりしている。
sen.e: In addition, LTR, which has been spread in Europe, was introduced (to Toyama Light Rail) and parking lots for "park and ride" have been developed.
In addition, LTR, which has been spread in Europe, was introduced (to Toyama Light Rail) and parking lots for "park and ride" have been developed.
In addition, LRT, which has been spread in Europe, was introduced (to Toyama Light Rail) and parking lots for "park and ride" have been developed.

sen.j: 東海旅客鉄道はリニアモーターカー方式である中央新幹線の整備を行うことを決定しており、日本の鉄道網の高速化はさらにすすむことになる。
sen.e: Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) has already decided to construct Chuo Shinkansen, which uses linear motor trains, showing Japan's unceasing movement toward faster railway network.
Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) has already decided to construct Chuo Shinkansen, which uses linear motor trains, showing Japan's unceasing movement toward faster railway network.
Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) has already decided to construct Chuo Shinkansen, which uses linear motor trains, showing Japan's unceasing movement toward faster railway network.

sen.j: 航空
sen.e: Aviation
Aviation
Aviation

sen.j: 九州では全ての県に空港があるなど全国に空港の建設が行われた。
sen.e: Airports have been constructed all over Japan, and, as a matter of fact, every prefecture in Kyushu has an airport.
Airports have been constructed all over Japan, and, as a matter of fact, every prefecture in Kyushu has an airport.
Airports have been constructed all over Japan, and, as a matter of fact, every prefecture in Kyushu has an airport.

sen.j: 一方でハブ空港となるような空港の建設は行えていない。
sen.e: On the other hand, however, no hub airport has been constructed yet in Japan.
On the other hand, however, no hub airport has been constructed yet in Japan.
On the other hand, however, no hub airport has been constructed yet in Japan.

sen.j: 成田国際空港は東アジアの拠点空港という地位を保っていたが、滑走路が計画されたどおりに進まないために中華人民共和国の香港国際空港や大韓民国の仁川国際空港などに奪われつつある。
sen.e: Although Narita International Airport used to keep its position as a hub airport in East Asia, Hong Kong International Airport in China and Incheon International Airport in Korea are taking this position, because the construction of runways of Narita International Airport has not moved forward as planned.

Although Narita International Airport used to keep its position as a hub airport in East Asia, Hong Kong International Airport in China and Incheon International Airport in Korea are taking this position, because the construction of runways of Narita International Airport has not moved forward as planned.

Although Narita International Airport used to keep its position as a hub airport in East Asia, Hong Kong International Airport in China and Incheon International Airport in South Korea are taking this position, because the construction of runways of Narita International Airport has not moved forward as planned.

sen.j: 交通体系を基準にした地方区分
sen.e: Regional division based on the transportation system
Regional division based on the transportation system
Regional division based on the transportation system

sen.j: 交通体系や道路地図などでは地形的条件に則り、律令時代の五畿七道や、江戸時代の五街道などを目安として、地方を区分することが多い。
sen.e: There are many cases where regions are divided roughly based on Goki-Shichido in the Ritsuryo era and Go-kaido Road in the Edo period for a transportation system or road map in accordance with the topographical conditions.
